text: almost 100 billion dollars a year that's
the value of the global arms market and
Britain is a huge player second only to
the United States in cash terms in total
deals worth seven point seven billion
pounds were approved last year arm sales
are licensed by the government but as
we'll see countries the UK has human
rights concerns about can still buy
British arms so who is buying well some
big contracts in the last decade include
helicopters to Norway and South Korea
and fighter jets to Oman and India but
one region buys big last year two-thirds
of all UK defense orders were from the
Middle East with Saudi Arabia the UK's
most valuable client in the last few
years the UK has delivered to Saudi
Typhoon jet fighters and thousands of
missiles and laser-guided bombs and
contracts for more Hardware have been
approved MPs are upset now because Saudi
Arabia is engaged in a conflict in Yemen
and they are worried British arms are
being used Saudi is also on the list of
countries the British Foreign Office
thinks are of human rights concern
billions of pounds of Defense export
licenses have actually been approved to
almost all the countries on last year's
list including rifles and body armor to
Sri Lanka and Afghanistan and
cryptographic technology to pretty much
everyone from China to Zimbabwe there
are strict criteria for granting export
licenses and the UK government says all
these deals are compliant and licences
are refused or revoked if they don't
meet the guidelines Britain is a major
player in a trade that involves many
countries in a complex web the world's
biggest exporter is the USA it shipped
arms to 61 different countries last year
while India and Saudi are the world's
biggest buyers in a growing global
industry
